question:
A solutions architect is creating a data processing job that runs once daily and can take up to 2 hours to complete. If the job is interrupted, it has to restart from the beginning.

How should the solutions architect address this issue in the MOST cost-effective manner?

options.A: Create a script that runs locally on an Amazon EC2 Reserved Instance that is triggered by a cron job.
options.B: Create an AWS Lambda function triggered by an Amazon EventBridge scheduled event.
options.C: Use an Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) Fargate task triggered by an Amazon EventBridge scheduled event.
options.D: Use an Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) task running on Amazon EC2 triggered by an Amazon EventBridge scheduled event.

explanation: ECS Fargate is serverless and charges only for the compute time used. For a job that runs once daily for up to 2 hours, Fargate is more cost-effective than Reserved Instances (24/7 cost). Lambda has a 15-minute timeout limit, making it unsuitable for 2-hour jobs.
